alert.note: Alert for Nuckolls; Thayer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 2:11AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas, including the following county, Jewell. Portions of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Nuckolls and Thayer. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that minor flooding of mainly small creeks and possibly some rural roads is likely still ongoing in parts of the Advisory area, due to between 2 and 4 inches of rain that has fallen in much of the area since Friday evening. Additional rainfall early this morning should only average around one-half inch before coming to an end. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Rose Creek, Dry Creek, Crosby Creek, Spring Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Deshler, Chester, Hardy, Ruskin, Byron, Hubbell and Gilead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
